cli progress bar benchmark

Gábor Csárdi

2021-10-06

Source: vignettes/progress-benchmark.Rmd
progress-benchmark.Rmd

Introduction

We make sure that the timer is not TRUE, by setting it to ten hours.

library(cli)
# 10 hours
cli:::cli_tick_set(10 * 60 * 60 * 1000)
cli_tick_reset()
#> NULL
`__cli_update_due`
#> [1] FALSE

R benchmarks

The timer

fun <- function() NULL
ben_st <- bench::mark(
  `__cli_update_due`,
  fun(),
  .Call(ccli_tick_reset),
  interactive(),
  check = FALSE
)
ben_st
#> [38;5;246m# A tibble: 4 × 6[39m
#>   expression                  min   median `itr/sec` mem_alloc `gc/sec`
#>   [3m[38;5;246m<bch:expr>[39m[23m             [3m[38;5;246m<bch:tm>[39m[23m [3m[38;5;246m<bch:tm>[39m[23m     [3m[38;5;246m<dbl>[39m[23m [3m[38;5;246m<bch:byt>[39m[23m    [3m[38;5;246m<dbl>[39m[23m
#> [38;5;250m1[39m __cli_update_due           53ns     71ns 12[4m7[24m[4m5[24m[4m3[24m313.        0B        0
#> [38;5;250m2[39m fun()                     521ns    626ns  1[4m3[24m[4m5[24m[4m0[24m729.        0B        0
#> [38;5;250m3[39m .Call(ccli_tick_reset)    343ns    408ns  2[4m1[24m[4m0[24m[4m8[24m952.        0B        0
#> [38;5;250m4[39m interactive()              77ns    108ns  7[4m8[24m[4m3[24m[4m0[24m357.        0B        0
ben_st2 <- bench::mark(
  if (`__cli_update_due`) foobar()
)
ben_st2

cli_progress_along() 

seq <- 1:100000
ta <- cli_progress_along(seq)
bench::mark(seq[[1]], ta[[1]])

#> [38;5;250m2[39m ta[[1]]       400ns    509ns  1[4m8[24m[4m4[24m[4m1[24m124.        0B       0

for loop

This is the baseline:

f0 <- function(n = 1e5) {
  x <- 0
  seq <- 1:n
  for (i in seq) {
    x <- x + i %% 2
  }
  x
}

With progress bars:

fp <- function(n = 1e5) {
  x <- 0
  seq <- 1:n
  for (i in cli_progress_along(seq)) {
    x <- x + seq[[i]] %% 2
  }
  x
}

Overhead per iteration:

ben_taf <- bench::mark(f0(), fp())
ben_taf

Mapping with lapply

This is the baseline:

f0 <- function(n = 1e5) {
  seq <- 1:n
  ret <- lapply(seq, function(x) {
    x %% 2
  })
  invisible(ret)
}

With an index vector:

f01 <- function(n = 1e5) {
  seq <- 1:n
  ret <- lapply(seq_along(seq), function(i) {
    seq[[i]] %% 2
  })
  invisible(ret)
}

With progress bars:

fp <- function(n = 1e5) {
  seq <- 1:n
  ret <- lapply(cli_progress_along(seq), function(i) {
    seq[[i]] %% 2
  })
  invisible(ret)
}

Overhead per iteration:

Mapping with purrr

This is the baseline:

f0 <- function(n = 1e5) {
  seq <- 1:n
  ret <- purrr::map(seq, function(x) {
    x %% 2
  })
  invisible(ret)
}

With index vector:

f01 <- function(n = 1e5) {
  seq <- 1:n
  ret <- purrr::map(seq_along(seq), function(i) {
    seq[[i]] %% 2
  })
  invisible(ret)
}

With progress bars:

fp <- function(n = 1e5) {
  seq <- 1:n
  ret <- purrr::map(cli_progress_along(seq), function(i) {
    seq[[i]] %% 2
  })
  invisible(ret)
}

Overhead per iteration:

ticking() 

f0 <- function(n = 1e5) {
  i <- 0
  x <- 0 
  while (i < n) {
    x <- x + i %% 2
    i <- i + 1
  }
  x
}
fp <- function(n = 1e5) {
  i <- 0
  x <- 0 
  while (ticking(i < n)) {
    x <- x + i %% 2
    i <- i + 1
  }
  x
}
ben_tk <- bench::mark(f0(), fp())
#> Warning: Some expressions had a GC in every iteration; so filtering is disabled.
ben_tk
#> [38;5;246m# A tibble: 2 × 6[39m

#> [38;5;250m1[39m f0()         22.2ms   25.3ms   34.7       41.3KB    3.85 
#> [38;5;250m2[39m fp()          12.1s    12.1s    0.082[4m5[24m    96.2KB    0.825

#> [1] 121µs

Traditional API

f0 <- function(n = 1e5) {
  x <- 0
  for (i in 1:n) {
    x <- x + i %% 2
  }
  x
}
fp <- function(n = 1e5) {
  cli_progress_bar(total = n)
  x <- 0
  for (i in 1:n) {
    x <- x + i %% 2
    cli_progress_update()
  }
  x
}
ff <- function(n = 1e5) {
  cli_progress_bar(total = n)
  x <- 0
  for (i in 1:n) {
    x <- x + i %% 2
    if (`__cli_update_due`) cli_progress_update()
  }
  x
}
ben_api <- bench::mark(f0(), ff(), fp())
#> Warning: Some expressions had a GC in every iteration; so filtering is disabled.
ben_api
#> [38;5;246m# A tibble: 3 × 6[39m
#>   expression      min   median `itr/sec` mem_alloc `gc/sec`
#>   [3m[38;5;246m<bch:expr>[39m[23m [3m[38;5;246m<bch:tm>[39m[23m [3m[38;5;246m<bch:tm>[39m[23m     [3m[38;5;246m<dbl>[39m[23m [3m[38;5;246m<bch:byt>[39m[23m    [3m[38;5;246m<dbl>[39m[23m
#> [38;5;250m1[39m f0()        36.88ms  40.17ms    24.3      19.9KB     1.87
#> [38;5;250m2[39m ff()        29.72ms  48.57ms    21.3      27.9KB     1.93
#> [38;5;250m3[39m fp()          5.52s    5.52s     0.181    25.3KB     1.09
(ben_api$median[3] - ben_api$median[1]) / 1e5

(ben_api$median[2] - ben_api$median[1]) / 1e5

C benchmarks

Baseline function:

SEXP test_baseline() {
  int i;
  int res = 0;
  for (i = 0; i < 2000000000; i++) {
    res += i % 2;
  }
  return ScalarInteger(res);
}

Switch + modulo check:

SEXP test_modulo(SEXP progress) {
  int i;
  int res = 0;
  int progress_ = LOGICAL(progress)[0];
  for (i = 0; i < 2000000000; i++) {
    if (i % 10000 == 0 && progress_) cli_progress_set(R_NilValue, i);
    res += i % 2;
  }
  return ScalarInteger(res);
}

cli progress bar API:

SEXP test_cli() {
  int i;
  int res = 0;
  SEXP bar = PROTECT(cli_progress_bar(2000000000, NULL));
  for (i = 0; i < 2000000000; i++) {
    if (CLI_SHOULD_TICK) cli_progress_set(bar, i);
    res += i % 2;
  }
  cli_progress_done(bar);
  UNPROTECT(1);
  return ScalarInteger(res);
}
SEXP test_cli_unroll() {
  int i = 0;
  int res = 0;
  SEXP bar = PROTECT(cli_progress_bar(2000000000, NULL));
  int s, final, step = 2000000000 / 100000;
  for (s = 0; s < 100000; s++) {
    if (CLI_SHOULD_TICK) cli_progress_set(bar, i);
    final = (s + 1) * step;
    for (i = s * step; i < final; i++) {
      res += i % 2;
    }
  }
  cli_progress_done(bar);
  UNPROTECT(1);
  return ScalarInteger(res);
}
library(progresstest)
ben_c <- bench::mark(
  test_baseline(),
  test_modulo(),
  test_cli(),
  test_cli_unroll()
)
ben_c
#> [38;5;246m# A tibble: 4 × 6[39m
#>   expression             min   median `itr/sec` mem_alloc `gc/sec`
#>   [3m[38;5;246m<bch:expr>[39m[23m        [3m[38;5;246m<bch:tm>[39m[23m [3m[38;5;246m<bch:tm>[39m[23m     [3m[38;5;246m<dbl>[39m[23m [3m[38;5;246m<bch:byt>[39m[23m    [3m[38;5;246m<dbl>[39m[23m
#> [38;5;250m1[39m test_baseline()   108.67ms 111.58ms     8.52     2.08KB        0
#> [38;5;250m2[39m test_modulo()        2.09s    2.09s     0.478    2.24KB        0
#> [38;5;250m3[39m test_cli()           2.21s    2.21s     0.453   23.73KB        0
#> [38;5;250m4[39m test_cli_unroll() 109.91ms 133.36ms     6.83     3.38KB        0
(ben_c$median[3] - ben_c$median[1]) / 2000000000
#> [1] 1.05ns

Display update

We only update the display a fixed number of times per second. (Currently maximum five times per second.)

Let’s measure how long a single update takes.

Iterator with a bar

cli_progress_bar(total = 100000)
bench::mark(cli_progress_update(force = TRUE), max_iterations = 10000)
#> [32m■                               [39m   0% | ETA:  7m
#> [32m■                               [39m   0% | ETA:  4h
#> [32m■                               [39m   0% | ETA:  3h
#> [32m■                               [39m   0% | ETA:  2h

Iterator without a bar

cli_progress_bar(total = NA)
